question: The distance '<katex>$s$</katex>' in meters travelled by a particle in '<katex>$t$</katex>' seconds is given by <katex>$s=\frac{2t^{3}}{3}-18t+\frac{5}{3}$</katex>. The acceleration when the particle comes to rest is
explanation: Particle comes to rest when <katex>$v = 0 \implies 2t^2 = 18 \implies t^2 = 9 \implies t = 3$</katex> sec (since <katex>$t>0$</katex>).
